[Motorist & Parking](https://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/motorist.shtml)

Weekend Traffic Advisory
========================

Friday June 20 to Sunday June 22, 2025
--------------------------------------

This traffic alert details the locations of road construction and other events that will affect the flow of traffic this weekend. This information is subject to change. Check the [Weekly Traffic Advisory](https://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/weektraf.shtml)Check the [Special Traffic Advisory](https://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/trafalrt.shtml)Check [Gridlock Alert Days](https://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/gridlockalert.shtml)

Other state and local agencies are responsible for street construction work in New York City. Visit the [Department of Design and Construction](http://www1.nyc.gov/site/ddc/index.page), the [New York State Department of Transportation](https://www.dot.ny.gov/index), the [Port Authority of New York and New Jersey](http://www.panynj.gov/) and [MTA](http://web.mta.info/bandt/traffic/) for more construction and traffic information. [Check who operates bridges and tunnels](https://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/infrastructure/bridges.shtml#nondot)

The times listed for closures for street fairs are for the actual times of the street fairs themselves. The streets may be closed for longer to allow for set-up and breakdown. Street fair organizers are generally permitted to begin set-up at 8 am and breakdown must be completed by 7 pm.

*   [Bronx](https://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/wkndtraf.shtml#bronx)
*   [Brooklyn](https://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/wkndtraf.shtml#brooklyn)

---------

This street will be closed from 8 am to 6 pm Saturday, and 9 am to 6 pm Sunday through 6/29/25 for building inspection from boom truck.

This street will be closed from 9 am to 3 pm Monday to Friday through 7/18/25 to excavate.

This street will be closed from 7 am to 5 pm Saturday and Sunday through 7/6/25 to facilitate crane operation.

This street will be closed from 8 am to 6 pm Saturday, and 9 am to 6 pm Sunday through 6/21/25 for building inspection from boom truck.

This street will be closed from 8 am to 6 pm, and 9 am to 6 pm Sunday through 6/29/25 for building inspection from boom truck.

This street will be closed from 9 am to 2 pm Monday to Friday through 6/30/25 to replace 20’ watermain.

This street will be closed from 7 pm to 3 am weeknights through 7/25/25 for installation of conduit system for reinforcement.

This street will be closed from 8 am to 6 pm Saturday, and 9 am to 6 pm Sunday through 6/29/25 for boom truck.

**Wall Street between William Street and Hanover Street**
This street will be closed from 8 am to 6 pm Saturday, and 9 am to 6 pm Sunday through 6/29/25 for boom truck to lift garage doors.

**Wall Street between William Street and Hanover Street**

**Harlem River Ramp between 2nd Avenue Southbound (2nd Avenue) and 2nd Avenue Northbound (Harlem River Drive)**
This ramp will be closed from 7 am to11pm Monday to Friday through 7/19/25 for installation of new 13k feeder across Harlem River.

**Riverside Drive between West 152nd Street and West 153rd Street**
This street will be closed 24/7 through 6/30/25 for NYCDOT contract HBM1165 rehab Riverside Drive viaduct over West 158th Street, Manhattan (safety reasons).

**FDR Drive between Montgomery Street and East 15 Street**
Single-lane northbound and/or southbound will be closed Monday to Thursday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning, Saturday from 12:01 am to 9 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 11 am. Double-lane will be closed Tuesday to Friday from 1 am to 5 am, Saturday from 1 am to 7 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 7 am. These closures are necessary to facilitate median reconstruction and will continue through August 15, 2026.

**FDR Drive Southbound between Jackson Street and Cherry Street**
Single-lane will be closed Friday from 11 pm to 7 am next morning, and Sunday from 11 pm to 10 am next morning. Double-lane will be closed Tuesday to Friday from 1 am to 5 am, Saturday from 1 am to 6 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 7 am. These closures are necessary to facilitate East Side Coastal Resiliency Project and will continue through September 11, 2026.

**Route 9A/West Street (between W 27th and W 33rd Streets)**
Northbound Route 9A will be reduced from four to three lanes Monday nights through Friday mornings 9 pm to 5 am and between 9 am and 3 pm, Saturdays 12:01 am to 10 am, Sunday 12:01 am to 1 pm, and from four to two lanes weeknights 12:01 am to 5 am, Saturdays 1 am – 8 am, and Sundays 2 am to 10 am. Southbound Route 9A will be reduced from three to two lanes Monday nights to Friday mornings 9 pm to 5 am, Saturdays 12:01 am to 9 am, Sundays 12:01 am to 10 am, and from three lanes to one lane weeknights 12:01 am to 5 am, Saturdays 1 am to 6 am, and Sundays 2 am to 8 am. These closures will be ongoing through June 20 by the Port Authority to facilitate construction of the Gateway Trans-Hudson Tunnel.

**Southbound Henry Hudson Parkway (HHP) Exit Ramp to West 79TH Street (Exit #10)**
This ramp will be fully closed from 12:01 am to 7 am on Saturday, June 14 and on Sunday, June 15 and nightly from 10 pm to 5 am from Monday night to Friday morning through June 20, 2025 to facilitate preparation for the summer phase of the reconstruction of the Rotunda Complex traffic interchange by NYCDOT-Bridges.

**Battery Park Underpass between FDR Drive and Route 9A/West Street**
Periodically the northbound and/or southbound tube will be fully closed nightly between 11 pm and 4 am, as permitted by NYCDOT Bridges for tunnel maintenance and repairs through June 30, 2025.

**West Street between Jane Street and Horatio Street**
This street will be closed from 7 am to 4 pm Friday through 7/6/25 for associated closure.

**Horatio Street between West Street and Washington Street**
This street will be closed from 7 am to 4 pm Friday through 7/6/25 for associated closure.

**Jane Street between West 4th Street and Greenwich Avenue**

**Jane Street between West Street and Washington Street**

**Jane Street between Joe DiMaggio Highway and Washington Street**
This street will be closed from 7 am to 3 pm Monday to Friday through 6/26/25 for booming and pumping operations for new building construction.

Manhattan/Bronx
---------------

**Broadway Bridge over the Harlem River**
A single lane will be closed from 7 am to 3 pm, through Thursday July 3, 2025, and a double-lane closed from 10 am to 2 pm. These closures are in addition to the current Manhattan-bound right lane and adjacent sidewalk closures. At least one lane of traffic and the North-bound sidewalk will remain open at all times. These closures are to perform NYCDOT Bridges electrical work and machinery repairs on the Broadway Bridge.

-----

### Festivals, Parades and Events

#### 13th Annual McCarren 5k Run/Walk

The following streets will be closed for the 13th Annual McCarren 5k Run/Walk on Saturday, June 21st, 2025 at the discretion of the NYPD in Brooklyn.

**Formation & Dispersal:**

*   Leonard Street between Manhattan Avenue and Bayard Street

**Route:**

*   Bayard Street between Leonard Street and Union Avenue
*   Roebling Street between Union Ave and North 4 Street
*   North 4th Street between Roebling Street and Kent Avenue
*   Kent Avenue between North 4th Street and North 14th Street
*   Franklin Street between North 14th Street and Quay Street
*   Quay Street between Franklin Street and West Street
*   West Street between Quay Street and Greenpoint Avenue
*   Greenpoint Avenue between West Street and Manhattan Avenue
*   Manhattan Avenue between Greenpoint Avenue and Leonard Street

#### 43rd Annual Mermaid Parade & Festival

The following streets will be closed for the 43rd Annual Mermaid Parade & Festival on Saturday, June 21st, 2025 at the discretion of the NYPD in Brooklyn.

**Embargo:**Special Event Construction Embargo / **June 19th, 2025 – June 21st, 2025**

**Formation:**

*   West 21st Street between Neptune Avenue and Boardwalk
*   West 22nd Street between Neptune Avenue and Boardwalk
*   West 23rd Street between Neptune Avenue and Dead End
*   Surf Avenue between West 21st Street and West 24th Street

**Route:**

*   Surf Avenue between West 21st Street and West 10th Street
*   West 10th Street between Surf Avenue and Boardwalk

**Festival:**

*   Stillwell Avenue between Surf Avenue and Boardwalk

#### Midwood Mardi Gras Festival

The following streets will be closed for the Midwood Mardi Gras Festival on Sunday, June 22nd, 2025 at the discretion of the NYPD in Brooklyn.

**Borough:**Brooklyn

**Location(s):**

*   Avenue M between Ocean Avenue and 13th Street

#### Desfile Y Festival Latinos De NY Parade

**Formation:**

*   Graham Avenue between Metropolitan Avenue and Ainslie Street

**Route:**

*   Graham Avenue between Ainslie Street and Cook Street

**Dispersal:**

*   Graham Avenue between Cook Street and Debevoise Street

Queens
------

**24th Street between 41st Avenue and Queens Plaza North**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday through 8/20/25 for boom, knuckle boom and concrete pump to work on new building.

**29 Street between 30 Drive and 31 Avenue**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday through 7/12/25 for rebar boom deliveries and concrete pump, boom truck.

**30th Street between 40th Avenue and 39th Avenue**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday through 8/5/25 for concrete operations.

**40th Avenue between 22nd Street and 23rd Street**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday through 7/1/25 to facilitate crane operation.

**40th Avenue between 29th Street and 30th Street**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday through 8/5/25 for concrete operations.

**40th Avenue between Northern Boulevard and 30th Street**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday through 8/5/25 for concrete operations.

**44th Avenue between 58th Street and 59th Place**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday through 9/1/25 to facilitate crane operation.

**51st Street between Roosevelt Avenue and Queens Boulevard**
This street will be closed from 5 am to 3 pm Saturday and/or Sunday through 6/22/25 for MTA contract A-46026 five stations rehab, demo repair work.

**56th Street between Broadway and Northern Boulevard**
This street will be closed from 10 pm to 5 am weeknights Friday for trenching.

**68th Street between Roosevelt Avenue and 41st Avenue**
This street will be closed from 5 am to 5 pm Saturday and/or Sunday through 6/22/25 for MTA contract A-46026 five stations rehab, demo repair subway platform at 69th Street Station.

**70th Street between Roosevelt Avenue and 38th Avenue**
This street will be closed from 5 am to 5 pm Saturday and/or Sunday through 6/22/25 for MTA contract A-46026 five stations rehab, platform demo repair work at 69th Street Station.

**93rd Street between 97th Avenue and 95th Avenue**
This street will be closed from 8 am to 6 pm Saturday, and 9 am to 6 pm Sunday through 7/13/25 to facilitate crane operation.

**104th Street between 86th Avenue and Jamaica Avenue**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday, and 5 am to 9 pm Saturday and Sunday through 6/29/25 for mainline track repairs.

**105th Street between 86th Avenue and Jamaica Avenue**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday, and 5 am to 9 pm Saturday and Sunday through 6/29/25 for mainline track repairs.

**110th Street between 86th Avenue and Jamaica Avenue**
This street will be closed from 9 am to 4 pm Friday, and 5 am to 9 pm Saturday and Sunday through 6/29/25 for mainline track repairs.

**114th Street between Liberty Avenue and 103rd Avenue**
This street will be closed from 8 am to 6 pm Saturday and Sunday through 6/22/25 for Sandy Power repairs.

**165th Street between Hillside Avenue and 88th Avenue**
This street will be closed from 8 am to 6 pm Saturday and/or 9 am to 6 pm Sunday to facilitate crane operation.

**130 Avenue Bridge over Belt Parkway**
The bridge will be closed Monday to Friday from 7 am to 7 pm, Saturday from 8 am to 6 pm and Sunday from 9 am to 6 pm. The north sidewalk of the bridge will continue to be closed; pedestrians may use the south sidewalk. One lane in each direction will be maintained. These closures are to facilitate rehabilitation work through June 28, 2025.

**Belt Parkway between Exit 21B and Exit 20**
Single-lane westbound will be closed Monday to Thursday from 10 am to 2 pm and 10 pm to 5 am next morning, Friday from 10 pm to 6 am next morning, and Saturday from 10 pm to 11 am next morning. Double-lane westbound will be closed Monday to Friday from 1 am to 5 am, Saturday from 1 am to 6 am, and Sunday from 2 am to 9 am. These closures are necessary to facilitate JFK Redevelopment Program and will continue through December 31, 2025.

**Grand Central Parkway at Long Island Expressway Interchange**
Single-lane eastbound will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 am to 2 pm, Monday to Thursday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning, Friday from 10 pm to 7 am next morning, Saturday from 10 am to 3 pm and from 10 pm to 3 pm next day. Double-lane eastbound will be closed Monday to Friday from 12:01 am to 5 am, Saturday from 1 am to 6 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 9 am. Single-lane westbound will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 am to 3 pm, Monday to Thursday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning, Friday from 10 pm to 6 am next morning, Saturday from 10 am to 3 pm and from 10 pm to 3 pm next day. Double-lane eastbound will be closed Monday to Friday from 12:01 am to 5 am, Saturday from 12:01 am to 6 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 9 am. These closures are necessary to facilitate Safety and Mobility Improvements and will continue through April 23, 2026.

**Grand Central Parkway Eastbound between Roosevelt Avenue and 54 Avenue**
Eastbound mainline will be closed for 15 minutes at a time, Monday to Friday from 12:01 am to 5 am, Saturday from 1 am to 6 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 9 am through April 23, 2026, to facilitate sign structure removal and installation. Mainline shoulder lane will be closed 24/7 along the project limit to replace sections with traversable curbs and guiderail.

**Hillside Avenue Bridge over Cross Island Parkway**
Single-lane and double-lanes will be closed Monday to Friday from 9 am to 7 pm, 10 am to 2 pm (double-lane closures), Saturday from 8 am to 6 pm, and Sunday from 9 am to 6 pm. These closures are to facilitate rehabilitation and underdeck repairs and will continue through June 28, 2025.

**Cross Bay Boulevard Bridge between North Conduit and South Conduit Avenue**
Beginning Wednesday March 26, 2025 for approximately 6 weeks, there will be a single and double lanes closure on both North Conduit (between 114th Place and Cross Bay Boulevard) and South Conduit Avenue (between Gemini Fields near 79th Street and continuing on Nassau Expressway to Cross Bay Boulevard, on weekdays from 9 pm to 6 am and on weekends from 9 pm to 7 am. One lane in each direction will remain open at all times. Additionally, the staging area on North Conduit Avenue (on local road, west of Cross Bay Boulevard) remains in place. The left lane is closed, and North Conduit Avenue is limited to one travel lane at this location. This work is being done to continue lead paint removal and protective coating operations.

**Springfield Boulevard Bridge over Belt Southern Parkway between North Conduit Avenue and South Conduit Avenue**
Single-lane and double-lanes on the Belt Parkway will be closed Monday June 9, 2025, 10 pm to 5 am (single-lane closure) and 1 am to 5 am (double-lane closure) through July 3, 2025, for the continued rehabilitation of the eastern sidewalk of the Springfield Boulevard Bridge. One lane in each direction will be maintained, and turning movements will not be affected. One sidewalk will remain open for pedestrian access, and one crosswalk will be maintained at all times. Traffic lanes will return to its normal configuration after work hours.

**Nassau Expressway between Cross Bay Boulevard Entrance Ramp and Exit 2N**
Single-lane eastbound will be closed Monday to Thursday from 10 am to 3 pm and 9 pm to 5 am next morning, Friday from 10 pm to 7 am next morning, and Saturday from 10 pm to 7 am next morning. Double-lane eastbound will be closed Monday to Friday from 12:01 am to 5 am, Saturday from 12:01 am to 7 am, and Sunday from 12:01 am to 7 am. Eastbound Exit Ramp 2S will be closed Monday to Thursday from 11 pm to 7 am next morning, Friday from 11 pm to 7 am next morning, and Saturday from 11 pm to 7 am next morning. These closures are necessary to facilitate JFK Redevelopment Program and will continue through December 31, 2025.

**Northbound Van Wyck Expressway Ramp to Eastbound Belt Parkway**
There will be a long-term ramp closure (Exit 1A) from northbound Van Wyck Expressway to Eastbound Belt Parkway from 10 am Monday March 10 to 6 am Friday August 22, 2025. Motorists travelling from the northbound Van Wyck Expressway, will need to utilize Nassau Expressway to access the eastbound Belt Parkway. Once motorists merge onto Nassau Expressway, they should follow the signage to southbound JFK Expressway, then take exit 2N to access eastbound Belt Parkway. This closure is necessary to facilitate bridge replacement as part of NYCDOT’s Van Wyck Expressway capacity and access improvements project (contract 3).

**Van Wyck Expressway**
Single-lane in both directions will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 am to 2 pm, Monday to Thursday from 10 pm to 6 am, Friday from 11:59 pm to 8 am, Saturday from 11 pm to 10 am, and Sunday from 10 pm to 6 am. Double-lane in both directions will be closed Monday to Thursday from 11 pm to 4 am and Sunday from 1 am to 7 am. Double-lane will be closed Friday from 11 pm to 7 am for northbound and from 11 pm to 5 am for southbound. The exit and entrance ramps along the north and southbound of the expressway may also be closed. These closures are necessary to facilitate roadway widening and will continue through July 14, 2025.
